description:
Write a Python programme which, given the length of the opposite (O) and adjacent (A) sides of a right angled triangle determine the hypotenuse (H) using Pythagoras theorem:
H2 = O2 + A2
Assume sides are to be inputted as floating point numbers.
correct-program:
import math
opposite = float(input('Input the opposite side of a right angled triangle ')) adjacent = float(input('Input the adjacent side of a right angled triangle '))
hypotenuse = math.sqrt((opposite**2)+(adjacent**2)) print(f'Given: opposite = {opposite}, adjacent = {adjacent}') print(f'Result: hypotenuse = {hypotenuse}')
